methods.name: waitForWindowByTitleContaining
methods.comment: Deprecated

return.comment: window

methods.name: waitForWindow
methods.comment:
Waits for a window with the given name.  If parentWindow is not null, then it
 will be used to find subordinate windows.  If parentWindow is null, then all
 existing frames will be searched.

params.name: parentWindow
params.comment:
The parent of the window for which to search, or null to search all
        open frames

params.name: title
params.comment: The title of the window for which to search

params.name: timeoutMS
params.comment: The timeout after which this method will wait no more

return.comment: The window, if found, null otherwise.

methods.name: waitForWindow
methods.comment: Waits for a window with the given name.

params.name: title
params.comment: The title of the window for which to search

params.name: timeoutMS
params.comment: The timeout after which this method will wait no more

return.comment: The window, if found, null otherwise.

methods.name: waitForWindow
methods.comment: Waits for a window with the given name

params.name: title
params.comment: The title of the window for which to search

return.comment: The window, if found, null otherwise.

methods.name: waitForWindowByName
methods.comment: Waits for a window with the given name.

params.name: name
params.comment: The name of the window for which to search

return.comment: The window, if found, null otherwise

Check for and display message component text associated with
 ErrLogDialog and OptionDialog windows.

return.comment: the message string if one can be found; null otherwise

methods.comment: Get the dialog provider's status text

methods.javadoc:
Will try to close dialogs prompting for changes to be saved, whether from program changes
 or from tool config changes.
methods.name: closeSaveChangesDialog
methods.comment:
Will try to close dialogs prompting for changes to be saved, whether from program changes
 or from tool config changes.

methods.name: closeAllWindowsAndFrames
methods.comment:
A convenience method to close all of the windows and frames that the current Java
 windowing environment knows about

methods.javadoc:
A convenience method to close all of the windows and frames that the current Java
 windowing environment knows about
methods.name: closeAllWindows
methods.comment:
A convenience method to close all of the windows and frames that the current Java
 windowing environment knows about

methods.name: waitForJDialog
methods.comment:
Waits for the JDialog with the given title
 
 Note: Sometimes the task dialog might have the same title as the dialog you pop up and
 you want to get yours instead of the one for the task monitor.

params.name: title
params.comment: the title of the dialog

return.comment: the dialog

methods.name: waitForJDialog
methods.comment:
Waits for the JDialog with the indicated title and that is parented to the indicated window
 
 Note: Sometimes the task dialog might have the same title as the dialog you pop up and
 you want to get yours instead of the one for the task monitor.

params.name: window
params.comment: the parent window

params.name: title
params.comment: the title of the dialog

params.name: timeoutMS
params.comment: Maximum time to wait for the dialog

return.comment: the dialog

methods.name: findComponent
methods.comment: Returns the first Component of the given type inside of the given dialog

params.name: provider
params.comment: the dialog

params.name: desiredClass
params.comment: the class of the component

return.comment: the component; null if none was found

methods.name: waitForDialogComponent
methods.comment:
Returns the DialogComponentProvider with the given title.  This method is
 not preferred, but instead you should use a #waitForDialogComponent(Class)
 that takes a class so that you can get the correct return type.  This method is meant
 for clients that need a dialog, but that type is private of package restricted and thus
 cannot be referenced by a test.   Also, code that relies on a title is more subject to
 breaking when code is refactored; code that relies on class types will get refactored
 along side the referenced code.

 This method will fail if no dialog can be found

params.name: title
params.comment: the title of the desired dialog

return.comment: the dialog

methods.name: waitForDialogComponent
methods.comment: Waits for the first window of the given class.

params.name: ghidraClass
params.comment: The class of the dialog the user desires

return.comment: The first occurrence of a dialog that extends the given ghirdraClass

methods.name: waitForDialogComponent
methods.comment:
Waits for the first window of the given class.  This method assumes that the desired dialog
 is parented by parentWindow.

params.name: parentWindow
params.comment: The parent of the desired dialog; may be null

params.name: clazz
params.comment: The class of the dialog the user desires

params.name: timeoutMS
params.comment:
The max amount of time in milliseconds to wait for the requested dialog
        to appear.

return.comment: The first occurrence of a dialog that extends the given ghirdraClass

methods.name: getDialogComponent
methods.comment: Gets a dialog component provider of the given type

params.name: ghidraClass
params.comment: the class of the desired DialogComponentProvider.

return.comment: the dialog or null if it cannot be found

methods.name: getDialogComponentProvider
methods.comment:
Gets the dialog component provider that is inside the given window or null if a
 provider of the given class type is not in the window.

params.name: window
params.comment: the window that contains the desired provider.

params.name: ghidraClass
params.comment: the class of the desired provider

return.comment: the desired provider or null if the window does not contain a provider of the given type.

methods.name: getComponentProvider
methods.comment:
Searches for the first occurrence of a ComponentProvider that is an instance of
 the given providerClass.

params.name: clazz
params.comment: The class of the ComponentProvider to locate

return.comment: The component provider, or null if one cannot be found

methods.javadoc:
Searches for the first occurrence of a {@link ComponentProvider} that is an instance of
 the given <tt>providerClass</tt>.  This method will repeat the search every
 {@link #DEFAULT_WAIT_DELAY} milliseconds
 until the provider is found, or the maximum number of searches has been reached, where
 <tt>maximum number of searches = MaxTimeMS / {@link #DEFAULT_WAIT_DELAY} </tt>
@param clazz The class of the ComponentProvider to locate
@return The component provider, or null if one cannot be found
methods.name: waitForComponentProvider
methods.comment:
Searches for the first occurrence of a ComponentProvider that is an instance of
 the given providerClass.  This method will repeat the search every
 #DEFAULT_WAIT_DELAY milliseconds
 until the provider is found, or the maximum number of searches has been reached, where
 maximum number of searches = MaxTimeMS / #DEFAULT_WAIT_DELAY

params.name: clazz
params.comment: The class of the ComponentProvider to locate

return.comment: The component provider, or null if one cannot be found

methods.javadoc: These providers are those that appear in dialogs outside of the main frame
methods.name: getDetachedWindowProvider
methods.comment: These providers are those that appear in dialogs outside of the main frame

methods.javadoc:
A recursive method to get the first encountered ComponentProvider instance of the give component provider class.

Note: this method assumes the given node is not a RootNode, but a child thereof @param node The Node instance that contains the desired ComponentProvider or other nodes. @param providerClass The ComponentProvider class for which to search.
methods.name: getComponentProviderFromNode
methods.comment:
A recursive method to get the first encountered ComponentProvider instance of the give
 component provider class.
 
 Note: this method assumes the given node is not a RootNode, but a child thereof

params.name: node
params.comment:
The Node instance that contains the desired ComponentProvider
        or other nodes.

params.name: providerClass
params.comment: The ComponentProvider class for which to search.

methods.name: waitForComponentProvider
methods.comment:
Searches for the first occurrence of a ComponentProvider that is an instance of
 the given providerClass.  This method will repeat the search every
 #DEFAULT_WAIT_DELAY milliseconds
 until the provider is found, or the maximum number of searches has been reached, where
 maximum number of searches = MaxTimeMS / #DEFAULT_WAIT_DELAY

params.name: parentWindow
params.comment:
The window that will become the parent window of the provider (this is
        typically the tool's frame).

params.name: providerClass
params.comment: The class of the ComponentProvider to locate.

params.name: maxTimeMS
params.comment: The maximum amount of time to wait.  This is an approximation (see above).

return.comment: The component provider, or null if one cannot be found

methods.name: pressButtonByText

params.name: provider
params.comment: the DialogComponentProvider containing the button.

params.name: buttonText
params.comment: the text on the desired JButton.

methods.name: pressButtonByText
methods.comment:
Finds the button with the indicated TEXT that is a sub-component
 of the indicated container, and then programmatically presses
 the button.

params.name: provider
params.comment: the DialogComponentProvider containing the button.

params.name: buttonText
params.comment: the text on the desired JButton.

params.name: waitForCompletion
params.comment:
if true wait for action to complete before returning,
 otherwise schedule action to be performed and return immediately.

methods.javadoc:
Finds the toggle button with the given name inside of the given container and then ensures that the selected state of the button matches selected.

Note: this works for any instanceof {@link JToggleButton}, such as:

  • {@link JCheckBox}
  • {@link JRadioButton}
as well as {@link EmptyBorderToggleButton}s. @param container a container that has the desired button as a descendant @param buttonName the name of the button (you must set this on the button when it is constructed; if there is no button with the given name found, then this method will search for a button with the given text @param selected true to toggle the button to selected; false for de-selected
methods.name: setToggleButtonSelected
methods.comment:
Finds the toggle button with the given name inside of the given container and then
 ensures that the selected state of the button matches selected.
 
 Note: this works for any instanceof JToggleButton, such as:
 
 	JCheckBox
  JRadioButton
 
 as well as EmptyBorderToggleButtons.

params.name: container
params.comment: a container that has the desired button as a descendant

params.name: buttonName
params.comment:
the name of the button (you must set this on the button when it is
                   constructed; if there is no button with the given name found, then this
                   method will search for a button with the given text

params.name: selected
params.comment: true to toggle the button to selected; false for de-selected

methods.javadoc:
Ensures that the selected state of the button matches selected.

Note: this works for most toggle button implementations which are derived from AbstractButton and relay on {@link AbstractButton#isSelected()} and {@link AbstractButton#doClick()} for toggling, such as:

  • {@link JCheckBox}
  • {@link JRadioButton}
  • {@link EmptyBorderToggleButton}
@param button the button to select @param selected true to toggle the button to selected; false for de-selected
methods.name: setToggleButtonSelected
methods.comment:
Ensures that the selected state of the button matches selected.
 
 Note: this works for most toggle button implementations which are derived from
 AbstractButton and relay on AbstractButton#isSelected() and
 AbstractButton#doClick() for toggling, such as:
 
 	JCheckBox
  JRadioButton
  EmptyBorderToggleButton

params.name: button
params.comment: the button to select

params.name: selected
params.comment: true to toggle the button to selected; false for de-selected

methods.name: assertToggleButtonSelected
methods.comment: Checks the selected state of a JToggleButton in a thread safe way.

params.name: button
params.comment: the toggle button for which to check the selected state.

params.name: selected
params.comment: the expected state of the toggle button.

methods.name: assertEnabled
methods.comment: Checks the enablement state of a JComponent in a thread safe way.

params.name: component
params.comment: the component for which to check the enablement state.

params.name: enabled
params.comment: the expected enablement state for the component.

methods.name: getActionsByName
methods.comment: A helper method to find all actions with the given name

params.name: tool
params.comment: the tool containing all system actions

params.name: name
params.comment: the name to match

return.comment: the matching actions; empty list if no matches

methods.name: getActionsByOwner
methods.comment:
A helper method to find all actions with the given owner's name (this will not include
 reserved system actions)

params.name: tool
params.comment: the tool containing all system actions

params.name: name
params.comment: the owner's name to match

return.comment: the matching actions; empty list if no matches

methods.name: getActionsByOwnerAndName
methods.comment:
A helper method to find all actions by name, with the given owner's name (this will not 
 include reserved system actions)

params.name: tool
params.comment: the tool containing all system actions

params.name: owner
params.comment: the owner's name

params.name: name
params.comment: the owner's name to match

return.comment: the matching actions; empty list if no matches

methods.name: getAction
methods.comment:
Finds the singular tool action by the given name.  If more than one action exists with
 that name, then an exception is thrown.  If you want more than one matching action,
 the call #getActionsByName(DockingTool, String) instead.

 Note: more specific test case subclasses provide other methods for finding actions
 when you have an owner name (which is usually the plugin name).

params.name: tool
params.comment: the tool containing all system actions

params.name: name
params.comment: the name to match

return.comment: the matching action; null if no matching action can be found

methods.name: getAction
methods.comment:
Finds the action by the given owner name and action name.  
 If you do not know the owner name, then use  
 the call #getActionsByName(DockingTool, String) instead  (this will not include
 reserved system actions).
 
 Note: more specific test case subclasses provide other methods for finding actions 
 when you have an owner name (which is usually the plugin name).

params.name: tool
params.comment: the tool containing all system actions

params.name: owner
params.comment: the owner of the action

params.name: name
params.comment: the name to match

return.comment: the matching action; null if no matching action can be found

methods.name: getLocalAction
methods.comment: Returns the action by the given name that belongs to the given provider

params.name: provider
params.comment: the provider

params.name: actionName
params.comment: the action name

return.comment: the action

methods.name: getAction
methods.comment: Returns the given dialog's action that has the given name

params.name: provider
params.comment: the dialog provider

params.name: actionName
params.comment: the name of the action

return.comment: the action

methods.javadoc:
Performs the specified action within the Swing Thread. This method will block until the action completes. Do not use this method if the given actions triggers a modal dialog. Instead, call {@link #performAction(DockingActionIf, boolean)} with a false value.

If the action results in a modal dialog, then call {@link #performAction(DockingActionIf, boolean)} with a value of false. @param action action to be performed (event will be null)
methods.name: performAction
methods.comment:
Performs the specified action within the Swing Thread.  This method will block until the
 action completes.  Do not use this method if the given actions triggers a modal
 dialog.  Instead, call #performAction(DockingActionIf, boolean) with a false
 value.

 If the action results in a modal dialog, then call
 #performAction(DockingActionIf, boolean) with a value of false.

params.name: action
params.comment: action to be performed (event will be null)

methods.name: performAction
methods.comment:
Performs the specified action within the Swing Thread.  If the action results
 in a modal dialog, waitForCompletion must be false.

params.name: action
params.comment: action to be performed

params.name: waitForCompletion
params.comment:
if true wait for action to complete before returning,
 otherwise schedule action to be performed and return immediately.

methods.name: performAction
methods.comment:
Performs the specified action with context within the Swing Thread.  If the action results
 in a modal dialog, waitForCompletion must be false.

params.name: action
params.comment: action to be performed

params.name: provider
params.comment:
the component provider from which to get action context; if null,
        then an empty context will used

params.name: wait
params.comment:
if true wait for action to complete before returning,
 		otherwise schedule action to be performed and return immediately.

methods.name: performDialogAction
methods.comment:
Performs the specified action with context within the Swing Thread.  If the action results
 in a modal dialog, waitForCompletion must be false.

params.name: action
params.comment: action to be performed

params.name: provider
params.comment: the component provider from which to get action context

params.name: wait
params.comment:
if true wait for action to complete before returning,
        otherwise schedule action to be performed and return immediately.

methods.name: performAction
methods.comment:
Performs the specified action with context within the Swing Thread.  If the action results
 in a modal dialog, waitForCompletion must be false.

params.name: action
params.comment: action to be performed

params.name: context
params.comment: the context to use with the action

params.name: wait
params.comment:
if true wait for action to complete before returning,
        otherwise schedule action to be performed and return immediately.

methods.name: setToggleActionSelected
methods.comment:
Ensures the given toggle action is in the given selected state.  If it is not, then the
 action will be performed.  This call will wait for the action to finish.

params.name: toggleAction
params.comment: the action

params.name: context
params.comment: the context for the action

params.name: selected
params.comment: true if the action is be be selected; false for not selected

methods.name: setToggleActionSelected
methods.comment:
Ensures the given toggle action is in the given selected state.  If it is not, then the
 action will be performed.  This call will wait for the action to finish.

params.name: toggleAction
params.comment: the action

params.name: context
params.comment: the context for the action

params.name: selected
params.comment: true if the action is be be selected; false for not selected

params.name: wait
params.comment: true to wait for the action to finish; false to invoke later

methods.name: findComponentByName
methods.comment:
Searches the component and subcomponents of the indicated provider and returns the
 component with the specified name.

params.name: provider
params.comment: the provider of the component to search

params.name: componentName
params.comment: the name of the desired component

return.comment: the component, or null if not found

methods.name: triggerActionKey
methods.comment:
Simulates a user typing a single key.

 This method should used for the special keyboard keys
 (ARROW, F1, END, etc) and alpha keys when associated with actions.

params.name: c
params.comment: the component that should be the receiver of the key event; the event source

params.name: modifiers
params.comment:
the modifier keys down during event (shift, ctrl, alt, meta)
                  Either extended _DOWN_MASK or old _MASK modifiers
                  should be used, but both models should not be mixed
                  in one event. Use of the extended modifiers is
                  preferred.

params.name: keyCode
params.comment: the integer code for an actual key.

methods.name: forceTextComponentFocus
methods.comment:
Really unusual method to call non-public libraries to force the text components to
 focus on what we want and not what Java thinks the focus should be.

params.name: tc
params.comment: the text component

methods.name: triggerActionKey
methods.comment: Simulates a user initiated keystroke using the keybinding of the given action

params.name: destination
params.comment: the component for the action being executed

params.name: action
params.comment: The action to simulate pressing

methods.javadoc:
Simulates the user pressing the 'Enter' key on the given text field
@param tf the text field
methods.name: triggerEnter
methods.comment: Simulates the user pressing the 'Enter' key on the given text field

params.name: tf
params.comment: the text field

methods.javadoc:
Simulates a focus event on the given component
@param component the component upon which to trigger focus
methods.name: triggerFocusGained
methods.comment: Simulates a focus event on the given component

params.name: component
params.comment: the component upon which to trigger focus

methods.javadoc:
Types the indicated string using the {@link #triggerKey(Component, int, int, char)} method. This method should be used when typing into text components. For example, JTextFields and JTextAreas. All three events are fired, KEY_PRESSED, KEY_TYPED, and KEY_RELEASED.
Note: Handles the following characters:

ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
`1234567890-=[]\;',./
~!@#$%^&*()_+{}|:"<>?

It also handles '\n', '\t', and '\b'. @param destination the component to receive the events @param string the string to be typed.
methods.name: triggerText
methods.comment:
Types the indicated string using the
 #triggerKey(Component, int, int, char) method.

 This method should be used when typing into
 text components. For example, JTextFields and JTextAreas.
 All three events are fired, KEY_PRESSED, KEY_TYPED, and KEY_RELEASED.

 Note: Handles the following characters:
 
 ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ
 abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
 `1234567890-=[]\;',./
 ~!@#$%^*()_+{}|:"?
 
 It also handles '\n', '\t', and '\b'.

params.name: destination
params.comment: the component to receive the events

params.name: string
params.comment: the string to be typed.

methods.javadoc:
Types the indicated string using the {@link #triggerKey(Component, int, int, char)} method. This method should be used when typing into text components. For example, JTextFields and JTextAreas. All three events are fired, KEY_PRESSED, KEY_TYPED, and KEY_RELEASED.
Note: Handles the following characters:

ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
`1234567890-=[]\;',./
~!@#$%^&*()_+{}|:"<>?

It also handles '\n', '\t', and '\b'. @param destination the component to receive the events @param string the string to be typed. @param consumer the consumer of the text to be generated
methods.name: triggerText
methods.comment:
Types the indicated string using the
 #triggerKey(Component, int, int, char) method.

 This method should be used when typing into
 text components. For example, JTextFields and JTextAreas.
 All three events are fired, KEY_PRESSED, KEY_TYPED, and KEY_RELEASED.

 Note: Handles the following characters:
 
 ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ
 abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
 `1234567890-=[]\;',./
 ~!@#$%^*()_+{}|:"?
 
 It also handles '\n', '\t', and '\b'.

params.name: destination
params.comment: the component to receive the events

params.name: string
params.comment: the string to be typed.

params.name: consumer
params.comment: the consumer of the text to be generated

methods.name: triggerKey
methods.comment:
Fires a KeyListener#keyPressed(KeyEvent), KeyListener#keyTyped(KeyEvent)
 and KeyListener#keyReleased(KeyEvent) for the given key code and char.

 If the key you need is not a character, but is an action, pass
 KeyEvent#CHAR_UNDEFINED for the keyChar parameter.

params.name: c
params.comment: the destination component

params.name: modifiers
params.comment: any modifiers, like Control

params.name: keyCode
params.comment: the key code (see KeyEvent's VK_xyz values)

params.name: keyChar
params.comment: the key char or KeyEvent#CHAR_UNDEFINED

methods.name: getClipboardText
methods.comment: Gets any current text on the clipboard

throws.comment: if there are any issues copying from the clipboard

return.comment: the text on the clipboard; null if no text is on the clipboard

methods.name: setErrorGUIEnabled

params.name: enable
params.comment: true to use the GUI; false to use the error console

methods.javadoc:
Signals that the client expected the System Under Test (SUT) to report errors.  Use this
 when you wish to verify that errors are reported and you do not want those errors to
 fail the test.  The default value for this setting is false, which means that any
 errors reported will fail the running test.
@param expected true if errors are expected.
methods.name: setErrorsExpected
methods.comment:
Signals that the client expected the System Under Test (SUT) to report errors.  Use this
 when you wish to verify that errors are reported and you do not want those errors to
 fail the test.  The default value for this setting is false, which means that any
 errors reported will fail the running test.

params.name: expected
params.comment: true if errors are expected.

methods.javadoc:
Turns off the gui displays for errors.  This does not change the "isUseErrorGUI()" value for
 other tests in the TestCase.
methods.name: disposeErrorGUI
methods.comment:
Turns off the gui displays for errors.  This does not change the "isUseErrorGUI()" value for
 other tests in the TestCase.

methods.name: showProvider
methods.comment: Shows the provider by the given name.

params.name: tool
params.comment: the tool in which the provider lives

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the provider to show

return.comment: the newly shown provider

methods.javadoc:
Closes the given provider.  You could just call
 {@link DockingTool#removeComponentProvider(ComponentProvider)}, but some providers have extra
 logic that happens when {@link ComponentProvider#closeComponent()} is called.   This will
 likely change in the future.
@param p the provider to close
methods.name: closeProvider
methods.comment:
Closes the given provider.  You could just call
 DockingTool#removeComponentProvider(ComponentProvider), but some providers have extra
 logic that happens when ComponentProvider#closeComponent() is called.   This will
 likely change in the future.

params.name: p
params.comment: the provider to close

methods.name: clickComponentProvider
methods.comment:
Performs a single left mouse click in the center of the given provider.  This is
 useful when trying to  make a provider the active provider, while making sure
 that one of the provider's components has focus.

params.name: provider
params.comment: The provider to click

return.comment: the actual Java JComponent that was clicked.

methods.javadoc:
If this dockable component is in a tabbed pane then select the associated tab.
@param dockableComponent the dockable component of interest
methods.name: selectTabIfAvailable
methods.comment: If this dockable component is in a tabbed pane then select the associated tab.

params.name: dockableComponent
params.comment: the dockable component of interest

methods.name: getDockableComponent
methods.comment: Get the dockable component that contains this component if there is one.

params.name: component
params.comment: the component that may be within a dockable component.

return.comment: the dockable component or null

methods.name: clickComponentProvider
methods.comment: Clicks the JComponent at the given point from within the given provider.

params.name: provider
params.comment: The provider to be clicked.

params.name: button
params.comment: The mouse button to use (left, center, right)

params.name: x
params.comment: the x location of the click

params.name: y
params.comment: the y location of the click

params.name: clickCount
params.comment: the number of times to click

params.name: modifiers
params.comment: the modifiers to apply (Ctrl, Alt, etc; 0 is none)

params.name: popupTrigger
params.comment: true if this click should show a popup menu

return.comment: the actual Java JComponent that was clicked

methods.javadoc: Prints all found windows that are showing, nesting by parent-child relationship.
methods.name: printOpenWindows
methods.comment: Prints all found windows that are showing, nesting by parent-child relationship.

methods.name: getOpenWindowsAsString
methods.comment:
Returns a pretty-print string of all found windows that are showing, nesting by
 parent-child relationship.

return.comment: the result string

methods.javadoc:
Create a task to be put onto the GTree queue.  This ensures that once the task is processed
 that any previously schedule tasks will have been run.
methods.name: submitTaskToGTreeQueue
methods.comment:
Create a task to be put onto the GTree queue.  This ensures that once the task is processed
 that any previously schedule tasks will have been run.

methods.name: createContext
methods.comment: Creates a generic action context with no provider, with the given payload

params.name: payload
params.comment: the generic object to put in the context

return.comment: the new context

methods.name: createContext
methods.comment: Creates a generic action context with the given provider, with the given payload

params.name: provider
params.comment: the provider

params.name: payload
params.comment: the generic object to put in the context

return.comment: the new context

methods.name: capture
methods.comment:
Creates and writes to file an image of the given component.  The file will be written
 to the reports directory (this differs depending upon how the test was run), nested
 inside a directory structure of the form {test class name}/{test name}.  A console
 statement will be written indicating the location of the written file.

params.name: c
params.comment: the component to capture

params.name: name

methods.name: createScreenImage
methods.comment:
Creates a png of the given component by capturing a screenshot of the image.  This
 differs from creating the image by rendering it via a Graphics object.

params.name: c
params.comment: the component

throws.comment: if there is a problem creating the image

return.comment: the new image

methods.name: writeImage
methods.comment: Writes the given image to the given file

params.name: image
params.comment: the image

params.name: imageFile
params.comment: the file

throws.comment: if there is any issue writing the image
